<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug description</denchmark-h>
tests\ignite\contrib\metrics\test_precision_recall_curve.py:4: in <module> from sklearn.metrics import precision_recall_curve c:\miniconda3\envs\test\lib\site-packages\sklearn\__init__.py:80: in <module> from .base import clone c:\miniconda3\envs\test\lib\site-packages\sklearn\base.py:21: in <module> from .utils import _IS_32BIT c:\miniconda3\envs\test\lib\site-packages\sklearn\utils\__init__.py:20: in <module> from scipy.sparse import issparse c:\miniconda3\envs\test\lib\site-packages\scipy\__init__.py:104: in <module> from . import _distributor_init c:\miniconda3\envs\test\lib\site-packages\scipy\_distributor_init.py:61: in <module> WinDLL(os.path.abspath(filename)) c:\miniconda3\envs\test\lib\ctypes\__init__.py:364: in __init__ self._handle = _dlopen(self._name, mode) E OSError: [WinError 126] The specified module could not be found Related to <denchmark-link:https://github.com/scipy/scipy/issues/12400>scipy/scipy#12400</denchmark-link>
A fix can be downgrading scipy to 1.4.1. <denchmark-h:h2>Environment</denchmark-h>
